meanings.definition: Enticed or lured someone into doing something
meanings.sent1: She wiled her friend into trying the new ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent2: The sly fox wiled the rabbit out of its burrow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat wiled the dog into a game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The enchanting melody wiled the audience into a trance.
meanings.sent5: His charming smile wiled her into agreeing to the plan.

meanings.definition: Passed time in a leisurely manner, especially in a playful or mischievous way
meanings.sent1: The children wiled away the afternoon playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: She wiled the hours away by reading her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The cat wiled away the time by chasing shadows.
meanings.sent4: The old man wiled away his retirement days fishing by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The friends wiled away the evening chatting and laughing together.
